adjectives.description: uppish (comparative more uppish, superlative most uppish)

examples: Uppish, rampant, crowing, full of Money. He is very Uppish, well lined in the Fob  […]
“Heah that John is livenin’ things up at the darky school,” volunteered the postmaster, after a pause.
“Oh, nothin’ in particulah,—just his almighty air and uppish ways.  […] ”

entries.meaning: (cricket, of a shot) In which the ball is hit into the air, with the chance of being caught.
examples: Six runs were still required, and an uppish stroke by the new arrival secured two of them.
